org.nevec.rjm

Class BigSurd

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nevec.rjm.BigSurd
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<BigSurd>

    public class BigSurd
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Comparable<BigSurd>
    Square roots on the real line. These represent numbers which are a product of a (signed) fraction by a square root of a non-negative fraction. This might be extended to values on the imaginary axis by allowing negative values underneath the square root, but this is not yet implemented.
    Since:
    2011-02-12
    Author:
    Richard J. Mathar

      • pref

        Rational pref
        Prefactor

      • disc

        Rational disc
        The number underneath the square root, always non-negative. The mathematical object has the value pref*sqrt(disc).

      • BigSurd

        public BigSurd(Rational a,
               Rational b)
        ctor given the prefactor and the basis of the root. This creates an object of value a*sqrt(b).

        a - the prefactor.
        b - the discriminant.
        Since:

      • BigSurd

               int b)

        Parameters:
        a - the numerator
        b - the denominator.
        Since:
        2011-02-12
